comment.author: 7925034@N06
comment._content: This was actually the first street sweeper of it's kind. With the revolving brush in back. Water tank and hose to spray the street mounted on the front. Unfortunately, no one knew how to operate the thing. The operator, driving his street sweeper , went aimlessly up and down the street, accomplishing nothing. His assistants, pretending to be in a parade, waving and smiling at everyone. Way ahead of it's time I suppose.

comment.author: 30115723@N02
comment._content: The Queensland Museum in Brisbane, Australia, has "Mephisto: the last surviving German A7V Sturmpanzerwagen" in its collection. You can read about it on on their website and there is a photograph of it on display on Wikicommons Liz

comment.author: 39686621@N04
comment._content:
I am concerned about the accuracy of the information associated with the photograph - that the tank in the photograph was "captured by Australians".

Un confirmed research suggests that the "Elfriede" was in fact captured by the British and French and eventually scrapped.

The only  German A7V Tank that I have direct knowledge of is the "Mephisto" , as my Australian Paternal Grandfather was present at its capture .
